label: id
comment: The W3C DID of the issuer - should be a did:web or did:tdw
The globally unique ID of the entity. ExamplesProduct - id.gs1.org/01/09520123456788/21/12345  Party - abr.business.gov.au/ABN/View?abn=90664869327. Facility - did:web:facilities.acme.com:123.
The globally unique identifier for the party. For example
The globally unique URI representing the specific classifier value

A globally unique Identifier for this facility. Given the plethora of faciloity registers for different purposes, this ID will increasingly likely be a DID created by the facility owner. The DID can then be associated with multiple registrations.
The globally unique identiifer of this geographic location. Typically a google pin.
The globally unique identifier of this product.
GLobally unique ID for the binary file - usually it's location as a URL. Recommend a UUID if the file is not intended to be easily discoverbale.
GLobally unique ID for the binary file - usually it's location as a URL. Recommend a UUID if the file is not intended to be easily discoverbale.
A unique identifier for the delcaration. Often this will be an extension of the product.id or attestation.id. But could be a UUID.
A unique identifier for the standard (eg https://www.iso.org/standard/60857.html).
The globally unique identifier of this regulation.
A unique identifier for the criteria within the standard  or regulation. For example CO2 emissions calaculations for liquid fule combusion.
The globally unique ID of this conformity attestation.
Globally unique identifier of an accreditation or authority issued to a confomrity assessment body by a regulator or national accreditation authority.

domainIncludes.comment: The issuer party ()person or orgnaition) of a verifiable credential.
The ID and Name of an identified entity such qs a product, facility, party, standard, etc
An organisation.  May be a supply chain actor, a certifier, a government agency.
A classification scheme and code / name representing a category value for a product, entity, or facility.
The physical site (eg farm or factory) where the product or materials was produced.
Location information including address and geolocation of points, areas, and boundaries
The ProductInformation class encapsulates detailed information regarding a specific product, including its identification details, manufacturer, and other pertinent details.
A file representing a data snapshot that is used to infomr the conformity assessment.
A binary file that is hashed ()for tamper evidence) and optionally encrypted (for confidentiality).
A specific assessment about the product or facility against a specific specification.  Eg the carbon intensity of a given product or batch.
A standard (eg ISO 14000) that specifies the criteria for conformance.
A regulation (eg EU deforestation regulation) that defines the criteria for assessment.
A specific rule or criterion within a standard or regulation. eg a carbon intensity calculation rule within an emissions standard.

A conformity attestation issued by a competent body that defines one or more assessments (eg carbon intensity) about a product (eg batttery) against a specification (eg LCA method) defined in a standard or regulation.
The authority under which a conformity claim is issued.  For example a national accrediation authority may accredit a test lab to issue test certificates about a product against a standard.
